com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.layers
Class FLyrDefault

java.lang.Object
  com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.layers.FLyrDefault
All Implemented Interfaces:
FLayer, LayerListener, Projected
Direct Known Subclasses:
FLayers, FLyrGT2_old, FLyrSecuential, FLyrText, FLyrVect, GraphicLayer
public abstract class FLyrDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements FLayer, LayerListener

Implementation of the common characteristics of all layers: visibility, activation, name, ...

Represents the definition of a basic layer, implementing FLayer, and new functionality:

  • Supports transparency.
  • Notification of evens produced using this layer.
  • Can have internal virtual layers.
  • Can have a text layer.
  • Supports an strategy for visit its geometries.
  • Can have an image in the TOC (table of contents) associated to the state of this layer.

Each graphical layer will inherit from this class and adapt to its particular logic and model according its nature.

See Also:
FLayer, FLayerStatus

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visibility)
Description copied from interface: FLayer

Changes the status of this layer to visible or not.

One layer is visible if it's check box associated is selected. This means that layer will tried to be painted. If the data associated isn't available, then this property will change to false.

Specified by:
setVisible in interface FLayer
Parameters:

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Description copied from interface: FLayer

Returns if this layer is visible and available.

One layer is visible if it's check box associated is selected. This means that layer will tried to be painted.

One layer is available if the source of data is on-line.

It's probably that one layer selected hadn't available it's data, for example in a remote service.

Specified by:
isVisible in interface FLayer
Returns:
true if this layer is visible and available; false otherwise
See Also:
FLayer.isAvailable(), FLayer.setAvailable(boolean), FLayer.visibleRequired()

getXMLEntity

public XMLEntity getXMLEntity()
                       throws XMLException

Returns an entity that represents this layer.

This XML entity has elements (properties) that represent and store information about this layer.

There are two kinds of information: default properties of this layer, and extended properties (they added that weren't by default)

Default properties:

  • className : name of this class
  • active : if this layer is active or not
  • name : name of this layer
  • minScale : minimum scale of this layer
  • maxScale : maximum scale of this layer
  • visible : if this layer is visible or not
  • proj : the projection of this layer (only if it's defined)
  • transparency : transparency level of this layer
  • isInTOC : if this layer is in the TOC or not

Extended properties: are stored as children of the tree-node returned. There are two kinds of information for a child, according if it's an instance of an String or of an object that implements the interface IPersistance.

  • Instance of String:
    • className : name of the class of the object that it's the property
    • value : value of the property
    • layerPropertyName : name of the extended property of the layer
  • Implements IPersistance:
    • Information returned by the implementation of the method getXMLEntity of that object
    • className : name of the class of the object (this information could be with the information returned by the method getXMLEntity of that object
    • layerPropertyName : name of the extended property of the layer

      Specified by:
      getXMLEntity in interface FLayer
      Returns:
      an XML entity with information to the current layer
      Throws:
      XMLException - if there is an error obtaining the object.
      See Also:
      setXMLEntity(XMLEntity), setXMLEntity03(XMLEntity)

setXMLEntity

public void setXMLEntity(XMLEntity xml)
                  throws XMLException

Inserts information to this layer.

This XML entity has elements that represent and store information about this layer.

The properties are the same as the described in getXMLEntity(). And the properties proj, transparency, isInTOC are optional.

The property numProperties is optional, and only used in old projects.

Specified by:
setXMLEntity in interface FLayer
Parameters:
xml - an XMLEntity with the information
Throws:
XMLException - if there is an error setting the object.
See Also:
getXMLEntity(), getXMLEntity()

  • name : name of this layer

  • transparency : transparency level of this layer (only if it's defined)

wakeUp

public void wakeUp()
            throws LoadLayerException

Method called by FLayers to notify this layer that is going to be added. This previous notification is useful for the layers that need do something before being added. For example, the raster needs reopen a file that could have been closed recently.

Throws:
LoadLayerException

cloneLayer

public FLayer cloneLayer()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: FLayer

This method can be used to have a fast cloned layer.

The implementations should take care of not recreate this layer. Instead of this, is better to use the same source (driver) and deepclone the legend. Exception: the labels aren't deepcloned to avoid memory consumption.

Note: Labels are memory consuming to speed up layers like PostGIS and so on.

Specified by:
cloneLayer in interface FLayer
Returns:
a layer that is a clonation of this layer
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - any exception produced during the cloning of this layer.

newComposedLayer

public ComposedLayer newComposedLayer()
Description copied from interface: FLayer

Returns a new instance of ComposedLayer.

This allows make a single draw for a group of layers with the same source.

If this operation isn't applicable for this kind of layer, this method returns null.

By default this operation is not supported.

Specified by:
newComposedLayer in interface FLayer
Returns:
a new composed layer or null if not supported
See Also:
ComposedLayer
